results.title: The Black swan
results.brief_description: The life history of the majestic black swan is depicted in its natural surroundings of swampland at the edge of lakes and lagoons. The nest which is made on reeds and twigs or any slight elevation in the swamp is defended against all comers. From 2-6 eggs are hatched and the cygnets take at once to the water. By six weeks they are almost adult and able to look after themselves. Swans are nomads and when heavy rain swamps their home they fly off to seek a new one. Scenes are included of other water birds such as pelicans, swamp hens and egrets. No other credits available.

results.title: The Black pirate. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited and narrated presentation of the duels, sea battles and acrobatics in the ‘Black Pirate’ an adventure film made in 1926 starring Douglas Fairbanks. Includes the famous sliding-down-the-sail stunt. Also stars Billie Dove.

results.title: The Black lake
results.creator_credit: Ronald Haines and British Foundation Pictures
results.brief_description: The famous asphalt lake in Trinidad is the scene of one of the island’s major industries. The film shows how the raw material is dug, processed, packed and shipped to many parts of the world. Trinidad asphalt is used for floors, roofs, electrical insulation and roads. Roads surfaced by Trinidad Lake asphalt are found the world over. The film includes a full account of operations at the asphalt refinery converting the raw material from the lake into the finished product ready for export.

results.title: The Black chain
results.creator_credit: Joseph Krumgold, Michael Sklar, Carousel Films and CBS Television Network
results.brief_description: Significant achievements in streptococcus research and the potential cure of rheumatic heart disease. Filmed at the Alfred I. Du Pont Institute in Wilmington, Delaware, showing the work of Dr Arnine T. Wilson. Microphotography shows the actions of white and red blood cells and the virulent form of streptococcus (Black chain) and the defence of one against the other.

results.title: The Birth of Soviet cinema
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Maxim Gorky Film Studio Moscow
results.brief_description: Examines the golden age of cinema in Russia in the 1920’s by presenting excerpts from masterworks of Eisenstein, Pudovkin and Dovzhenko by film critic Richard Schickel. Explains why the 1920’s was a productive time for cinema in general.

results.title: The Birth of Australia's golden age
results.brief_description: A history of the Australian gold rushes of the nineteenth century, which shows historical paintings and views of still extant gold mining towns. Demonstrates the various methods of extracting gold Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: The biology of behavior
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, David Stone, Steven Talley and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Humans are quick thinking, quick acting animals. This ability to react is controlled by the nervous system, which in turn is controlled by a complex system of neurotransmitters in the brain. This program examines the operation of these neurotransmitters, their effect on individual personality and what happens when these networks break down due to neurotransmitter diseases, in particular, Parkinson’s Disease.

results.title: The Biological control of insects [Excerpt]
results.brief_description: Shows a number of insect pests close-up in the laboratory. Outlines the success with which they have been controlled by their natural enemies and by the use of virus diseases. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: The Biological control of insects
results.brief_description: Shows some aspects of the entomologist’s work in his attempts to control insect pests by the use of their natural enemies. In telling the story of biological control the following pests are shown in cloe-up: cottony cushion scale, cabbage moth, green vegetable bug, cabbage white butterfly, vegetable weevil and Queensland fruit fly. Their natural enemies include predators, parasites and diseases.
